name: Chris R
comment: it's impossibly busy during term time. even with a premium membership it's difficult to get through a workout at any reasonable time of day. gym users don't have basic etiquette (putting back weights, getting in the way of those lifting, just generally wandering around aimlessly), classes are poorly scheduled and take up much more space than they need, and it's getting dangerous. the mirrors are terribly placed and designed for style rather than checking your form which is their actual purpose. we know that zoomers use the gym as a social place for some reason, but this isn't a nightclub and the gym space must adapt to this. the staff are very friendly and do appreciate these issues. it's also becoming impossible to book classes and those that you can book are often overfull with people just showing up without a ticket. hopefully management will give them resource to expand.

name: Jasse Parker
comment: this is a nice place for many physical exercises and activities. i go there regularly for playing and sport activities. the cost for membership is quite high for external people. the edge needs to come up with a different plan. people really struggle to pay for its facilities and they don't use all of them. for me, the next plan should be to have a membership plan for each facility and keep adding on top of them. they have a gym and many other facilities for example, squash, swimming, basketball, badminton, indoor football, cricket, climbing etc. booking required for any of these ones. they also gave a nice place for socializing and if you wish to sit and chit chat. parking is a big issue! and it is paid. although, it is a big parking area, it is also used by leeds university people and hence super busy all the time and hard to find a parking space. because of the parking cost, it makes the visit even more expensive for external visitors. other than that, it has wheelchair accessibility. 6 electric cars charging socket and all functioning. if you are lucky you might find one of them free. people are nice and friendly. they do have gym or swimming trainers as well.

name: MATTHEW WHITE
comment: the reception staff at the edge are always very good, welcoming and helpful. however on a different note after swimming yesterday morning for the 7:30 am session (7/9/25), and experiencing the revised lane set out it was a very dissatisfying lane swim. the 7:30 - 8:30 am saturday and sunday swims are supposed to be a lane swim with lanes to segregate swimmers of different abilities. however the removal of 3 lane ropes renders most of the pool as a free for all. and when the students come back and the pool gets busier then lane swimming will be a waste of time. and bearing in mind some very fast swimmers use these sessions there could be some very bad collisions. and to make matters worse, the already limited 1 hour swim (and that’s when swimmers are allowed in on time), has now being been shaved to 55 minutes, which is to enable the children’s swimming lessons to start earlier, bearing in mind these swimming lessons go on for several hours. another annoying aspect, particularly with the saturday swim is that the end lane during the 1 adult swim is hired out for private lane hire / swimming lessons, mainly for young children, often just 1 child in the end lane, which happens to be the widest lane in the pool. so pool space is already limited for the relatively time limited adult swim as it is. all i can say is that management should seriously consider installing all the lane ropes again, reinstating it as a 1 hour session, with the pool roller shutter door open on time and incorporating the private lane hire into the children’s swimming lessons program. ideally the adult 1 hour swim should be extended to 90 mins, with a 7 am start time.

name: Alice Flowerdew
comment: great gym, lots of equipment and good layout! sometimes very busy but kind of to be expected from a student gym and there's usually still always something available. staff are very nice and always welcoming. the swimming pool is lovely too.

name: Elspeth Mitchell
comment: i trained with abi at the edge in leeds for several months and can’t recommend her highly enough. she built a programme that really supported me to develop strength, but just as importantly, she gave me confidence in the gym. abi’s sessions were motivating, thoughtful and tailored to my needs, and she struck the perfect balance of encouragement and challenge. thanks to her, i feel stronger and more assured in my training than i ever have before.

name: dingsong cui (崔丁松)
comment: what a brilliant system this gym has! silly me—i thought asking a friend to hand me my own membership card right in front of reception would be the most transparent and honest thing to do. but apparently, that’s suspicious behaviour worthy of public questioning. incredible! of course, if someone were really trying to use a membership card that doesn’t belong to them, they’d definitely do it right in front of the reception desk, with cctvs and staff watching. because that’s exactly how criminal masterminds operate, isn’t it? i still don’t know if it’s technically against your rules to have a friend bring my card from my office. but one thing i’ve learned: next time i forget it, i’d better run all the way back and get it myself—otherwise, i might be treated to a truly delightful friday night interrogation. what a way to kick off the weekend! checking membership is your job, and i’m more than happy to cooperate. but barking orders like “don’t stand here” or “don’t stand there,” and speaking to people with unnecessary rudeness—now that’s real customer service. truly, the gentleman at the front desk was the most polite person i’ve ever encountered in the uk. is that also in your staff training manual? really, five stars just don’t do you justice. if i could, i’d give you ten out of five—you’ve clearly redefined customer experience. but since there’s no ten, i guess i’ll have to settle for giving you one.

name: James Barwick
comment: what an utter farce this facility (pool) has become! i have to question if the people making the decisions regarding the operation of the pool have spent a significant enough period on deck to make the ludicrous choices we as paying consumers are having to deal with?! why you ask....... (relates particularly to the 0730-0830 saturday and sunday sessions). a period of time where you would wonder if the full compliment of staff would arrive on time to open the pool! numerous pool system failures meaning the pool was never ready for the session to begin, but always for the lessons starting after! sometimes only being let in to the building barely minutes before the session is due to start, so loosing time in the water you are paying for as you are still getting changed. if you are in early enough to change, being let on poolside after the session has already started. extremely poor lane management (it will get worse later in this review!!!!). as slow or poor swimmers are regularly allowed to just jump in a lane doing head up breaststroke where people are swimming at incredible pace, leaving the faster swimmers to have to police. and now we get to the really really "good" bits! turn up to sunday session and thr pool that is usually 1.2m deep in the shallow end is now 0.9m. may no seem like a great issue to some, bit when you are as tall as i am it means you can't push off properly and have to severely alter your pull to not take the skin off you fingers. admittedly this did seem to be resolved after speaking to staff for following weeks at the expense of 5 minutes being taken off the session for staff to raise the pool for lessons. however no resulting % reduction in price paid or starting the session 5 minutes earlier to make up! and now the biggest debacle of the lot - the current, what i can only hope is experiment with the lane set up to again better accommodate the set up for the lessons following the session! historically one double lane and the rest of the pool in standard lane set up. now, this ridiculous set up of 2 double lanes sometimes labeled "fast". trust me no fast lane swimmer wants to swim in a lane like that. but this has just caused more disruption. people are swimming in no order in those lanes and they regularly dive out of those lanes into the singles lanes that are swimming in order and get in the way! i have in the past 3/4 weeks i have hurt my back avoiding a slower swimmer that should never have been in the lane as they floundered on the wall as i turned. this very morning i was unable to swim at the speed i wanted due to being invaded by someone who was not in the appropriate lane. (poor lane management again). this stupid set up if it continues will lead to accidents if it continues and swimmers i know currently not attending turning up. if i or those i swim with hit someone at full pace because they've jumped in the way, they will probably have to be rescued. people in the massed lanes swimming in no order will collide and i've regularly noticed how bad it is getting. any extra attendance pressure with only make this worse! clearly no attention has been paid to who swims over a significant period. people swimming at that time.on a weekend are serious swimmers, not there to mess around and want proper lanes, not what is currently in place. since returning from covid, prices have risen, service has dropped and now to comically poor levels!. i can say this not just as any other member of the public but a club and lane swimmer, former lifeguard and pool staff and just generally someone with common sense. what was probably the best pool to lane swim/train in within leeds has become, quite frankly a joke! maybe start listening to your customers and give us what we want, not what you think !

name: Merve Durmaz
comment: bad experience here today (13th july). i arrived around 12:45 to get changed ready to swim when the pool was supposed to open at 1pm. it was empty without staff when i arrived, although there were supposed to be lessons on, but there were no signs indicating that it was out of order. i got changed and waited past 1pm but no one came to open it. in the end, only when we asked were we informed that there was an issue with the chlorine pump so it was out of use. but the receptionist had watched 2 of us enter the changing room without saying anything. a sign or blocking the entrance (which they subsequently did) would have been really useful.

name: Chris Bevan
comment: great sports facility with almost everything you could ask for. a gym, swimming pool and various other activities. i only used the gym, it has a separate oly weights room with multiple squat racks (5/6) and deadlifting platforms. it then has a fitness suite and various free weight sections and a stretching/plyo space. the ample parking is free to the public after 5pm and weekends - don't chance it as anpr is in use. i was only visiting for a short while and so purchased 12 visits for £80. other gyms in the area (total fitness) wanted a minimum 3 week membership plus a bunch of joining/admin fees which would have come out at £180.

name: 尹兰馨
comment: i had a disappointing experience but the edge team sorted it fast. i have been a student in uni of leeds and i've kept buying edge membership even after graduation. it's been great dealing with the edge and spending time playing volleyball. until 09/07/2025, i called in to book a volleyball court and that lady just went straight away to ask me do it online coz she is busy. i get it and i'm happy to do it online if i can, but i can't as your system wouldn't allow me do it online for volleyball. because volleyball takes up three badminton courts and the system is not upgraded enough to do that yet. and i explained, that lady went straight away, if you can't do it online it means you can't book. please ma'am i've been doing this for a whole year would you learn more about your job and system first maybeif not its fine we can still make it work together but at least not be rudeit's so awful, ruined my day. i emailed the edge to raise the issue, and their team responded quickly and professionally with support and a clear explanation. i truly appreciate their follow-up and the way they handled it.

name: jon lal
comment: looked like a really nice place. was there for my son's water polo game. parking was right next to it and free from receiving a code from the gym receptionist.

name: Realying
comment: terrible staff here at the edge, attitude and customer service needs to be worked on by management. used to be a student at the uni of leeds and all they do is shout at you and get angry at you to leave this place.

name: Maha s
comment: my favourite place. the best gym thank you for homing us as students, alumni and healthy individuals. the place where standards are never compromised safe training, healthy body and mental health is preserved. sincere thanks to the edge management, teams and pts. all included with a special thanks to ali kteich, andy and claire angel of yoga.

name: Ganymede Harrogate
comment: unisex cubicles, some separate changing rooms for clubs, cool water temperature with poolside turkish steam room and sauna (cramped when busy). free parking (don't forget to obtain the code at reception desk and enter it into the ticket machine on departing!)

name: Ifunanya Nwigwe
comment: when i went to the edge, i did the birthday personal training session which was really fun. i really enjoyed my training sessions with my trainer abigail. she was very attentive and friendly. before we would start a training session, she would ask about how i was doing and what goals i had for each session. she was very good with teaching me how to use equipment i had never used before and whenever i felt tired or overwhelmed ,she would stop and try to make the workout easier for me. i highly recommend a personal trainer at the edge because it was nice to have someone to workout with and someone who can help you on your training journey.

name: Christopher Busby
comment: always friendly staff on reception. organized. sauna and steam room included in the price of a swim. clean modern facilities.

name: Will
comment: good football pitches. i have played at places which the pitch has not been great for ankles but this always seems to be fine.

name: Matthew Walker
comment: upgraded review to 5 star, as the situation below regarding the pool and sauna is resolved! overall the gym is pretty good, i'm happy with the equipment and cleanliness. however, the big issue for me is that if you would like to use the sauna or steam room you have to book a swim lane. i don't even want to go for a swim, and wouldn't like take a swimming spot from someone else. so because of this rule and the low swimming lane spots it's also difficult to actually book a swim lane even if i wanted to. the reception staff said this was a management decision. i'm more than happy to upgrade this review once the sauna and steam room are more accessible.

name: zak kushner
comment: great location and range of equipment. all the staff i’ve interacted with have been really friendly, helpful, and knowledgable. the membership is great value considering how many classes there are and the quality of them. only drawbacks are that the gym is very busy other than a couple hours in the afternoon and right before closing, and that rucksacks aren’t allowed in the gym.

name: Karina Sykora
comment: the gym is decent though crowded. the pools are very cold. they are "training pools" and there are no lesuire days where the pool is heated to a normal temperature for swimming. it's unpleasant. the excercise classes (yoga, spin class etc.) are great though, best thing about the edge in my opinion.

name: Rukiya Parveen
comment: i just come here for sauna n steam room. it is nice, but could do with a deep clean. mold in showers, and changing stalls are dirty. price is a bit on the high side.

name: Stanley Peterson
comment: great building but the receptionist on a friday was rude to my wife she made us stop going on these days.

name: Erin Laurenson
comment: great gym for students.. and they host all sorts of sporting events. for my visit i was able to watch friends play roller derby in one of their halls. great amount of space and helpful staff at reception to let you know where to go

name: emma roper
comment: nice gym and pool but the admin is shocking. no one seems to know what the pool timetable is, the printed version is always inaccurate - whether it's the depth of the pool, or what sessions are in. they don't publish the timetable until the week has already started making it hard to plan when you want to swim. the reception staff tell you one thing, the life guards another. plus the pool is also absolutely freezing. generally clean though and the showers are warm at least.

name: Ittefaq Ahmed Kiani
comment: certainly! "the edge" typically refers to the outermost part of something, often a boundary or border. it can also symbolize the forefront or cutting edge of technology, innovation, or any field. it evokes a sense of adventure, risk-taking, and pushing boundaries. metaphorically, "living on the edge" suggests living a daring or unconventional lifestyle.

name: Aravinda Ramakrishnan Srinivasan
comment: this is an university gym. really friendly staffs and excellent facilities. ideal location and public can also subscribe to be members. has an indoor climbing wall, gym with all lifting equipments, 4 wooden floor multipurpose courts for basketball/netball/volleyball/indoor cricket. there is a dedicated cycling and outdoor grass courts in boddington facility. has squash/racquetball facility along with swimming pool which has one of the biggest digital clock i have ever seen . 100% recommended to friends and family.

name: Shanid Chalil
comment: i had a terrible experience with the edge. i had booked the 5-a-side football court for 9:00 pm yesterday. since i was concerned that the pitch might be closed due to the weather, i called the reception at around 2:30 pm to confirm its availability. the person i spoke to assured me that the pitch would be open. however, when i arrived at 9:00 pm, a different staff member at the reception informed me that the pitch was unavailable due to the weather conditions. while i understand that a full refund will be provided, it is extremely disappointing that neither i nor my friends, some of whom traveled a considerable distance, were informed of the closure earlier. this lack of communication, especially after being assured the pitch was usable, is unacceptable.

name: David Conroy
comment: attended a dance competition here. well run. car parking was very reasonably priced for the whole day. was there for almost 12hrs and with the discount for attending the competition, only cost £5.

name: SUZANNE WARRINER
comment: special mention to firmin and surinder - hence 4 stars! came to have a look round and see what was available pool wise as my arthritis is becoming more severe and firmin could not have been more helpful. same when surinder who called me back today as i had left a voice mail with the edge a couple of days ago. both were very informative and very friendly - nothing was too much trouble. sadly for a 60yr old lady the mixed sex changing room arrangements in the pool area is a bit daunting and it was extremely hectic when i was there with the majority of changers being male. the female only changing room are ok but it only has lockers and one hairdryer... so will just dry/ change and shower at home. not a1 clean but far superior to the leeds city council pools i've been to see (all of which were very dirty and smelly). firmin did advise of the other female changing rooms on the other side of the building however that would mean walking in a costume all the way past the studios/ squash courts / reception to the pool.... i can't do that. i am going to try aqua sessions (bookable on line) and the 'women - only' sessions in the pool and see how i go.

name: Paul
comment: i think for being run by the university, it should be cheaper. but staff are great, the pool is great... actually i don't understand complaints about the water temperature, it's warmer than most pools i've been in. just take a cold shower before. actually, the swimming pool seems overstaffed, there are constantly at least two lifeguards even if there are hardly any swimmers. one would be enough. the gym should have an additional pullup machine, there is only one, and it's always in use. sometimes the music is a bit loud. i usually love the music selection, but sometimes i still listen to podcasts or my own music. i also see many (most?) others walking around with headphones, so by blasting the music so loudly you make us use our headphones at a higher volume, which is not great for our hearing. lastly, the sauna isn't hot enough because it's a small room and every few minutes someone opens the door to get in or out, so it cools down quite quickly. i guess that's unavoidable though. everything else is great. edit: soon after my review, the music volume was reduced a lot. i hope you didn't make that decision purely based on my review, it almost makes me feel guilty. however, i trust you enquired with others and reached the same conclusion. sorry for not reaching out to you, but i prefer to remain pseudonymous in my review.

name: Maia Dong
comment: update i contacted rob, he is really nice. i would like to say a big thank you to rob for understanding this situation and help us! so far, my friend and i in general have wonderful experience with the edge. the reception is always friendly and helpful. i am impressed by rob’s reply and how he deals with our sharing experience. i can feel they work together very well and ensure a friendly and safe environment for members. thank you again to the male staff with black beard this afternoon, you threatened me and my friend to leave because you claimed a workout session with friend is “coaching”. you kept pressing questions for a qualified license to my friend. but we are students and do usual workout here? btw, many couples of friends were doing workout and helping each other at the same time. whatever your truly intentions of your behavior, either for selling your lessons, sexism or else, you already got us attention of your manner, and ruined our experience with the edge. we will further escalate this issue if similar things happen
review_date: Fecha de edición: Hace un año

name: Claire Hutchison
comment: the pool is nice and the staff are lovely but the pool side private showers are a complete let down with 2 of the 4 being out of order for 3 months (since october) and the remaining 2 being temperamental. such a shame when all otherwise is so good.

name: Tom Wellings
comment: good: gym staff are great and is equipped well. the environment is also great for a workout and the gym itself is very clean. downside: it is really busy during term time, so i understand the booking system to use the sauna, but it’s pretty annoying (they didn’t used to have this before covid). the fact that a lost card costs £5 when you pay nearly £50 per month is also a joke. i don’t understand why they can’t use a qr code on the phone like most other gyms do (without issue). overall: it’s a great gym, although i don’t think they can fully justify the price as it currently is. however, when i am back in leeds, i certainly will rejoin as i’ve been coming here for years now.

name: Mohammad Afkhami
comment: best gym facilities in leeds. could do with boot camp and cross fit/hyrox classes though...will these ever be added to the class timetable?

name: hung929929
comment: i played here every week, the staff were great and friendly

name: Fatemeh Talebi
comment: i have been a member here since 2017. the customer service on the gym floor is always excellent. whenever i feel lost using some of the equipments, the staff are always there to support and help. thanks slavi and team for always making my experience great! a sense of community is what keeps it going!

name: Owen Prosser
comment: the gym facilities are great. the location is good if you are a student or work on the university campus. i wouldn’t recommend joining as a member of the public. the pool area (including the sauna and steam room) is closed all morning and into the mid afternoon on weekends.

name: S D
comment: excellent facility, by far the best uni gym i’ve been to and i’ve been to many. very well equipped gym, and the pool is great. staff are all friendly too. only downside is it can get very busy at peak times, but that is to be expected as it serves 30k students .

name: Roman Shaw
comment: first of all, the gym and the staff there are great, everything is always very clean and the equipment is new and good. the pool on the other hand has been deteriorating recently to a point where repeated and continuous faults are forming. firstly, the water fountain near the pool is in a constant state of out of order, once it is finally fixed it seems to break again within a week which is very disappointing. secondly, the sauna seems to be having repeated issues with the most recent one extending for a longer time. this is very disappointing at the start of a new term and the fact that a 'new part' takes so long is very disappointing. overall a good facility but with falling standards unfortunately concerning the pool area.

name: julia battista
comment: although the gym is a bit pricey, i was willing to pay for another year due to the fantastic equipment they provide, as well as the amazing customer service and approachability from the team. the staff are super friendly and always willing to help with any questions or even at times (politely) step in and advise you on your training. its always nice to feel like staff are there to help and motivate you - as well as being a friendly face - which is not something i can say for all gyms! although all the staff are lovely, i have had the best experience with slavi as he has always been super friendly to myself and others, and he given me some great advice or just a friendly chat and it feels like there is a proper nice gym community between the staff and the members because of these interactions! :)

name: Laura McLeay Smith
comment: i attended the fitness fiesta day yesterday at the edge. i've been a member for over a year now, but i've only attended a few of the classes offered (spinning and yoga etc), so it was great to get a taster of all the different types of classes they do. i will deffinately be going to the dance classes and body attack again!. all the instructors were so friendly too so it made me feel a lot more comfortable as i was nervous about going, but i had such a good time!

name: Tyler Robinson
comment: good gym but needs a proper cleaning staff. i’ve flagged this before several times at the desk and nothing has been done. i’ve been put off using the swimming facilities based on how bad the changing room smells of stagnant water. (clearly not being mopped) . hair buildup in the showers. the floors especially the yellow flooring near the fitness suite is so dirty and doesn’t look like it’s been cleaned since it was introduced. the men’s changing rooms smell disgusting especially in the toilet area and clearly aren’t cleaned regularly. the changing rooms in general aren’t cleaned. unclean floors and showers. overall the faculties in this gym are amazing and offer a great select of classes. but definitely the dirtiest gym i’ve had membership to .

name: Mike Jones
comment: lovely place for a swim and it's not highly chemical like the rest. i live 2 hours away and visit leeds once in a couple of months, as they now require you to book a slot, as a non member trying to book in for a swim session ( two days in advance) trying to get a slot is out of the question! i emailed requesting a slot and was told to call to pay and by the time i called they had all been taken. emailed at 6 am and called at 9am once i had taken care of children. i am very disappointed to say the least.

name: Huy Vu
comment: i am a new student coming to the university of leeds for my masters degree starting this september and the gym is one of the first things i need to sort out everywhere i go. i am very impressed with the facility at the edge, it is probably the best university gym i have seen. a staff called tian has been super friendly smiley and helpful, she sorted out everything for me, couldn't ask for more. highly recommended this place :)

name: Gellért Botond Pál
comment: i had the pleasure of participating in three training sessions with mr. emad dosky. he introduced me to an entirely new perspective on nutrition and training, opening my eyes to possibilities i hadn't considered before. during the trainings, he always made sure that i do not injure myself, but i push myself to my limits. he answered every question i asked about nutrition/training, and explained them to me patiently. his expertise and guidance made the sessions valuable. i recommend his training to anyone looking to improve themselves!

name: Felipe Gallardo
comment: my 5 stars go to the staff working here!! they are really helpful, always willing to help and with lots of knowledge on how to properly train. special mention (and thanks!) to highly motivated staff members as slavi (you must try his hiit classes) and chloe (body pump..haven't seen her in a while though...). people like them know how to push you to give your 110%, choose proper exercises, guide you through them and vary them so that it does not become boring. you can tell that they worry about our individual goals and they'll try to help you as much as possible to keep improving. their friendliness and motivation is invaluable! the gym facilities are great, with lots of equipment and rooms (swimming pool, indoor cycling, weightlifting..) and plenty of space even in crowded days/times. but, if it weren't for the staff and their excellent service, the gym would be just as any other.
review_date: Fecha de edición: Hace un año

name: Ivy Walowe
comment: beautiful place, very well organized with patient instructors. it has been great for my mental health.

name: Velka Kavarkova
comment: i have a membership just over a month and absolutely love it. staff on the reception is always very nice and polite, friendly and helpful. comfortable waiting area, swimming pool and training areas are always clean and tidy. all trainers and safeguards are very supportive, knowledgeable and experienced.

name: Florence Cummings
comment: i have been a member of the edge for a very long time now. excellent instructors in particularly ali kteich. i visited the gym last week and ali gave me some excellent advice. he demonstrated the right techniques of how to do certain exercises to help with my back pain. the facilities are up to date, clean and a welcoming gym. the reception staff are very friendly and helpful especially peter. the staff always makes me feel welcome. thanks to everyone.

name: David Hayes
comment: this gym is great. i started using the prowler which is a real tough piece of equipment!

name: Samira Farah
comment: while i appreciate certain aspects of this gym such as its convenient location i regret to say my overall experience has been disappointing. the cleanliness standards leave much to be desired, cold showers and changing rooms. additionally, i've found the classes to be disorganised during exams, christmas, or easter periods. it's frustrating that the gym is sometimes repurposed for exams, resulting in canceled classes due to noise disturbances. furthermore, only yoga and pilates classes seem to be consistently available, and instructors often fail to turn up during university holidays. when seeking assistance from the reception staff regarding class information, i found them to be uninformed and unable to provide a clear answers. considering these factors i cannot recommend this gym to others.

name: Tin
comment: great facilities, the pool is great for a nice swim as well as the sauna and the steam room. around 7£ for all the facilities to be used

name: Nathan Blott
comment: this is my second review as unfortunately i need to update. the good: a great pool and well equipped gym with a good range of classes the bad: class microphones seem to be constantly broken, frustrating attendees and instructors. blocked drain smell in the small male showers. the inexcusable: black mould in the swim showers. but most of all. today i was caught short after going to the toilet as not 1, not 2, but 3 toilets had no loo roll despite double dispensers. additionally there was no hand paper in the dispensers by sinks either. i was left humiliated and unhygienic. the others things are just gripes but to pay "premium membership" for a place that can't provide basic sanitation needs is foul. credit to the reception staff who did then sort this as soon as possible and gave me a feedback form however this should never be the state that any facility is left in.

name: Mark Wright
comment: the gym and pool are great. i love swimming there. i've given 2 stars, however, because the online booking system is really bad. there's been quite a few times when the system is down and won't let me log in, usually on weekends. i don't know if they switch it off on a weekend. yesterday the website didn't work at all. today there were no sessions available for swimming so i called several times and left a message. nobody got back to me. just checked now and all swim sessions are now available to book... you really need to upgrade your systems. and also make it easier to book, at the moment you have to add a class to a basket, then check out the basket, then confirm your booking and then you have to confirm it again. it's also not mobile friendly and needs to be responsive to mobile devices. gutted i didn't get to swim today, pretty disappointed...

name: Stephan Marlés Werner
comment: a proper gym that never has you waiting for equipment, even after the 5pm rush hour. after the renovation, there are endless squat/bench racks. worth the price if an alumni, student or extra money. if you’re a premium student member, note you have to email the help service to get your guest passes and reservation for any other service besides the gym like sauna or pool.

name: Mandy C
comment: [warning] i was bullied by a few staff in this gym. they raised strange requests targeted at colored people / women during training; and poured dirty water on me when i was explaining what happened in the class. moreover, the instructors of the exercise classes used to be late regularly (sometimes more than 20 minutes), but they kicked the customers out when they were only 5 minutes late. i'm very disappointed by them, i know quite a few people with very similar experiences. not recommended especially for colored / female individuals.

name: Zaakirah Hussain
comment: i have been at this gym over a year. the facilities are great and the upkeep is incredible however the staff everyday get worse if that’s even possible. they’re absolutely horrific and have no basic manners. i have friends + family who go to the leeds facility and have had numerous undertones of racism and unconscious biases towards them. this has been emailed but yet to be escalated further. they lack basic compassion and human decency. i don't think i got the memo were minorities have to adhere to different rules. thorough training + screening should be done at the hiring process. & teach your staff to smile once in a while!

name: Joanna Wilk
comment: great facility, good size swimming pool with the water that is cleaned using very little chlorine, water slightly on a cool side, as it is an olympic training pool, but you can warm up in the steam room or sauna though. gym machines are recently upgraded. nice, helpful staff and variety of classes to book. remember though it's a students and staff facility so there will be busy times to avoid if you don't like crowds, such as lunch time and 5/6pm. physio and massage is available to book as well. very convenient and friendly gym.

name: Mshari Alghadier
comment: great place to sweat up. don't miss the olympic swimming pool. they've got variety of classes as well.

name: Ian Broadbent
comment: my daughter has been doing swimming lessons hear for the past 3 years. staff are wounderfull. car park is free for the people with lessons. the lobby is big with a good amount of sofas to sit on, while watching the kids swimming lessons. i would recommend this place to every one. by far the best place for swimming lessons.

name: Cathy Coombs
comment: modern gym complex with excellent facilities. there is a large gym and squash courts, as well as space for various sports in the main halls. i've only used the pool and sauna, but they are the best i've been to; large, clean and centrally located on campus. you need a pound coin for the lockers and be aware that the changing area is mixed, with lockable cubicles. that threw me to start with, but is fine!

name: Paul T
comment: the university pool and sports centre is open to the public but they keep that quiet so that staff and students get an unofficial priority. great swimming pool, large sports hall, good gym and proper dedicated climbing wall are everything you could ask for. would get more stars but the front desk can be chaotic and recent staff shortages have seen cleaning standards slip badly.

name: Ben Musther
comment: our 6 year old daughter comes here every saturday morning for a 1:1 swimming lesson with charlotte (sorry don’t know last name) for over a year now. my daughter also goes to a public lesson during the week with a council swimming baths, this said our daughter would not be at the level of swimming she is now without charlottes input. myself and my wife feel and think charlotte does an amazing job with our 6 year old who sometimes her attention span can be short, charlotte is very good at understanding how to mix it up / bring the lesson back on track. well done charlotte and keep up the great job you’re doing. i hope management pass this review on to charlotte

name: Albert Panagopoulos
comment: pros: the gym offers a variety of equipment. equipment that you will propably will not find in conventional gyms. staff is very helpful and polite. male changing rooms and showers are clean. swimming pool is in good condition along with the steam room and sauna. swimming pool timetable is balanced and although the pool can get busy you can still do your workout. cons: the gym is very busy. i use the gym 6/7 days around noon and it is always packed. can’t get a rack for weights or space to do body exercises/sit ups/ etc. you have to wait to use any machine 90% of the time. i am swimming daily. the male toilets in the pool area are horribly unclean and unsanitary. every single time i have used the toilet is exactly the same. overall i have had a decent experience until now.

name: Meng Song
comment: i had the best personal training experience with an exceptional personal trainer slavi slavov, and i couldn't be more satisfied with the experience. his extensive knowledge and experience shine through in every session. the way he explains techniques is not only clear but also incredibly helpful, making each exercise easy to grasp and execute. what sets him apart is his unwavering commitment to safety. throughout every session, i felt well-protected as he closely monitored my form and provided corrections when needed. it's evident that safety is a top priority, allowing me to push my limits confidently. i've learned so much and am genuinely thrilled with the progress i've made. if you're looking for a knowledgeable, experienced, and safety-conscious personal trainer, look no further – i highly recommend slavi slavov. with his education background, work experience and enthusiasm for sports, it's a privilege to have him in the edge at the university of leeds.

name: Francesco Cavina
comment: really good gym. lots of equipment and quite spacious. close to uni and it’s free until 11am if you live in student residences so quite a bargain for the kind of gym you get.

name: Aiysha
comment: i began to use the edge gym almost 2 months ago by purchasing 20 hours of personal training sessions. unfortunately my timing meant most of my period spent at this gym was within the substituted training room(s) due to the summer refurbishment. that said, the booking system in place at the time for all members meant the limited capacity of gym space was never overcrowded and working out comfortably was still possible. luckily, i managed to spend 2 weeks working out in the newly refurbished gym space which evidently had a lot of thought put into its layout due to its spaciousness and abundance of newly purchased state-of-the-art technogym equipment everywhere. whilst working out, it was great to see staff cleaners walking around disinfecting and cleaning the equipment after use of others. i would definitely recommend the edge gym to others - especially university of leeds students, for which such a facility is an asset. i would also recommend investing in a personal trainer at the edge if you have the means as my experience with aimee lewis was nothing short of lovely. aimee focused on consolidating a strong foundation into my fitness by initially focusing solely on the basics of the mobility and posture required for optimising training at the gym. she then tailored my personal training programme each week to ensure i was both having fun and challenging myself a little more. i did spend a lot of time complaining to her how i hated what she put me through (lol) but i always left my gym sessions feeling so much better - both mentally and physically - each time. my lack of one star in this review is due to the membership options. i never purchased a membership as this was not required for personal training sessions. however, now that i had wanted to use the edge without a personal trainer, i was unhappy to learn the membership options were nothing less than a 3-month direct debit programme. the option of 1-month would’ve been better as i plan on going away soon. the one-off passes are also quite extortionate in my opinion, so do bear that in mind for those of you who are unable to commit.

name: cap 413
comment: great facilities for people wanting to do cardio - very poor for people wanting to strength train - specifically people who are wanting to start a weight training regime with lighter weights than the 20kg bar. there are only four fixed barbells, one is 15kg. only one smith machine which is always broken. poor layout - the only mirrors are at one end behind the free weights. there's no space to work out in front of them. the 'freestyle' area is full of equipment, no mirrors, all equipment is against the wall so people are constantly walking across your mat when you're working out. just badly thought out. i joined to try out the classes but they are constantly full. you are told to ring up at 6am 48 hrs before and book on - consequently i've not been able to get onto any of the popular classes. i think perhaps a waiting system would be a fairer way of allowing all people to enjoy the classes. pool is great though, steam room and sauna very good. heated floors in changing room. weight area and class system one star, the pool brings it up.

name: Lauren Batchelor
comment: the fitness suite can be quite busy at peak times but the fitness suite itself is incredible. there's a huge variety of both machines and weights to suite all training programmes. the fitness classes are also great in variety with generally wonderful instructors. all staff are lovely and helpful!

name: Pranesh Ganesaraja
comment: joe and surinder were incredibly helpful this morning. i needed to transport some equipment from the gryphon to the university campus and joe was incredibly considerate and kindly drove me up to the university saving me 4 rounds trips walking back and forth.

name: Augustina Guye
comment: after ending my membership at bannatyne gym in kirkstall, i was looking for a gym that was of equal standard; with a variety of classes and fully functional gym equipment (especially cardio), as well as a 25m pool. this gym definitely delivers on all aspects, i would definitely recommend someone takes a tour to see for themselves. look forward to joining this gym soon, i may just try out the climbing wall too!

name: Ubaid Ur-Rehman
comment: been a member here on and off for almost 10 years. just wanted to give a shout out to dale, one of the edge reps. i spoke to another rep about referring a friend to the gym and whether they would be eligible for a discounted membership. i was told flatly that this is not something they do and it is something that i can give as feedback instead. the rep didn't even bother trying to find out if there was a referral scheme (maybe new or there maybe a training need?). however, dale overheard the conversation, politely took over the conversation, went through the options and found a discounted referral rate for my friend. great customer service from dale, there was a willingness to get the extra info for me.

name: Samuel Thacker
comment: the first year discount is linked to your first year accommodation... so that when i was forced to move accommodation half way through the year due to emergency maintenance, they cancelled my membership. i was told there was absolutely nothing i could do about it and would have to buy another years membership.

name: Luca Wigley
comment: great gym with great equipment. loved my time training here. however like with most gyms in the world it gets busy in the afternoon and i also wish the gym was bigger in size.

name: Bindu Ganesh
comment: the edge! i should have visited this months ago when i joined my university! honestly, university of leeds students have a great space for sports for a reasonable price. they have studios, gym, pool, squash, badminton court, basket ball court, wall climbing and many more. i just got my edge club annual membership. hope you get time to check it out soon! happy time!

name: Ali XOXO
comment: the pool isn’t very friendly for slower swimmers. often times i come and those who should be in the fast lane have spread themselves out across all the lanes so they can have 1 each leaving no where for those who need the slow lane. i’d also be willing to go into the double lane at the near end however there is nearly always someone having an unofficial swimming lesson who have spread themselves out across the width of this area meaning you can’t swim a full length or again someone who’s a much better swimmer and should be in the medium/fast lane. as someone who wants to swim slowly and casually for mental health this pool makes that difficult and i’ve often left before i’ve wanted to because i’ve not felt welcome. the lifeguards just sit leaning on their hands looking bored or gossiping on their radios unbothered by any of this

name: Kerri Proctor
comment: the gym is expensive considering it's for students and the staff are generally unfriendly. the classes are great, if you can get on one without getting up at the crack of dawn to beat everyone else to it. the machines have touch screens and stuff though, you can watch tv on them.

name: Andy Walsh
comment: good facilities but over-crowded during term time. i've only given it 3 stars because the gym economises by having a membership team trying also to perform a customer service role when they do not have the skills or aptitude for it. as a customer for 10 months i had contact with their management who think they're quite good but to resolve basic membership issues they just deferred to their legal team. no clue. i haven't come across this approach before which is a shame and let's them down.

name: JH
comment: so i returned after months of lockdown to go swimming, i spent not even 2 minutes getting used to the water and loosening up in a pool of maybe 4 people and i'm immediately told that i must swim from end to end without stopping, for the entire session, which is really tough when you've not had a pool to swim in regularly over the previous 5 months. after one lap i needed to catch my breath. sensing i was about to get a warning i left the pool and asked about freezing or canceling my membership , for which i must communicate with someone via email. upon leaving via the wrong entrance a staff member scolded me with a disgusting tone as though i'd just stepped on someone's grave. there are cheaper gyms and pools that will provide much more value and convenience. this one isn't worth it.

name: Aidan Keegan
comment: alright gym nice range of facility’s

name: D R
comment: this gym is massively overrated. after being a member there for over a year i found that this was the dirtiest gym i ever been a member of, communication from staff was appalling and the standards of maintenance were unacceptable. some instructors were unprofessional using inappropriate language and treating members in a patronising and derogatory manner. considering not so cheap cost of membership it was not good value for money and i would not recommend this gym to anybody.

name: Mia Zhao
comment: i enjoyed the experiences in the edge. i like zumba classes. jemma, emma and katterine are all good teachers :). for my personal training, i have an appointment yesterday and molly gave me a best experience who taught me some useful skills. thank you all.

name: abid yaqub
comment: i like the squash courts, seem smaller than others. sauna room good, steam room not steamy enough and both a bit on the small side. swimming pool is good. no separate pool for kids. other facilities there but not used.

name: Jan Volhejn
comment: you pay 290£ a year as a student at university of leeds to get an overcrowded gym with an abundance of running machines with a ridiculously underwhelming amount of actual gym equipment especially considering the demand and staff who when you forget your card point ironically at a sign no card, no entry. what an amazing service, considering its almost twice the price of a normal gym.

name: Nic Taylor
comment: i went for a full health and fitness assessment today with andy & slavi. it was a comprehensive, enlightening session with competent, professional, knowledgeable, helpful guys. the results and printed report offer a good insight into my current level of fitness and areas to work on. very good customer service. thanks guys .

name: lll ccc
comment: i have a nice time in the edge and have some personal trainings. my pt molly is really nice, friendly and professional. she also knows a lot about nutrition. i have slight scoliosis, and we do a lot of spinal support training, it helps a lot.

name: Michael Furness
comment: this is the 3rd gym i visited in the last month and i’ve decided this is the best for me. it’s spacious and has a very nice pool. everything is very clean and the staff are 10/10. all the equipment is new and up to scratch, i’d recommend to all gym types.

name: Jenny Cromack
comment: i only swim at the edge, but it is by far the best pool in leeds where you can pay as you go and cheaper than council pools during off peak times (and much better!). it does get quite busy at peak times but if you are there to train and exercise it doesn't matter as everyone else is there to train, not just swim and chat! great staff too!

name: Alice Coates
comment: large gym with a great range of equipment. used when visiting leeds for a few days. will go again. highly recommend. reception staff were lovely and could not do more to help.

name: Marcus Bell
comment: a little hypocritical because i work here but that just means i'll look after you if you see me =). great facility with plenty of gym space and equipment. the pool is a great side and well cleaned and looked after, competitive pool so it's cooler than most and fab hall space/climbing wall/ lots more i can't oversell. =d come see for yourself. <3

name: H S
comment: extremely crowded during normal hours. overpriced for what you're getting. average quality gym equipment and extremely limited space. better to go to puregym as it offers better value for money and much better gym equipment. i'm kicking myself for not knowing puregym during my uni term. they think that they can get away with exorbitant membership prices just by being affiliated with the university. i strongly advise against getting a membership here. what a scam!

name: Harry Bennett-Cowell
comment: took part in the leeds university kickboxing tournament, which was a fantastic day. caught some mild concussion. the staff were really helpful. special mention to jacob who went to a&e to get me a wheelchair, then wheeled me to a&e. absolute legend. ps i hope you've started training brazilian juji-jitsu.

name: Ugne Krakauskaite
comment: quite a few classes are offered but they are booked very quickly so you need to book it at 6am two days before in order to get a place. facilities are always dirty and not cleaned properly. many different equipment machines available in the fitness suite.

name: Mohamed Abdi Mohamood
comment: this is the worst experience i’ve faced in a gym facility. i wanted to start swimming classes and the reception told me to email the swimming team. i did send an email but i received no response and then i sent another email but again no response. i went back to the reception and they said to me they were going to speak to the swimming team and i will get a correspondence. unfortunately i am yet to receive any response from them. i don’t think it’s worth putting money to a service like this. avoid it if you can at all cost!

name: Khaled Almisnid
comment: the overall experience was not bad. however, one lady in the reception was not friendly at all. i avoided to talk to her as i know her attitude but she shout loudly 'how i can help you' while i was waiting for the other lady in the reception which was very friendly and smiley.

name: Anna Lycett
comment: i use the swimming pool there as a member of public. it's reasonably priced, reasonably clean, though not always, the pool isn't heavily chlorinated and there's a sauna and a steam room that you can use there as well. it's the best pool in the area in terms of value for money by a long stretch!

name: Philip Igo
comment: lost my card on the way to the gym. i was asked to prove id which obviously i didn't have since i came with the bare minimum. i had my bank card to hire 2 squash rackets but she wouldn't accept that, i said i'm logged into facebook trying to find a mutual understanding, nope no good. i was then forced to pay £6 to be able to use the facilities. that wouldn't be so bad if i didn't already pay the overpriced amount of £40 a month. i couldn't verify who i was because they do not have pictures registered with your account on their system. i feel its a massive oversight for people who walk down to the gym who don't carry unnecessary items. the woman at the desk was very robotic and showed zero emotions when dealing with me, which made the whole thing so much worse. to make things worse i'm going to have to pay the £10 on top to replace my card.....

name: Amal B
comment: j'y ai pris un mois d'abonnement durant l'été. c'est un complexe sportif extra, l'accès illimité à la piscine est inclus, on peut y faire de l'escalade, du squash etc. concernant la piscine, il y a des créneaux pour femmes 2 fois 1 heure par semaine. les créneaux sont donc assez courts pour quelqu'un qui désire améliorer sa nage mais c'est déjà pas mal comparé à certains autres pays européens. il y aussi quantité de classes allant de la zumba à différents types de yoga en passant par des séances de pilates. les entraîneurs dans la salle de gym sont très accueillant et prêt à aider pour toute requête.

name: Muataz
comment: hi all, the number of people is always high and the equipment is always busy so you should wait for some time to train on the machine .. sometimes, it is even difficult to find a suitable area where you can train properly. the other thing is that the membership price is high compared to other gyms...

name: Scott Mcall
comment: absolute scam. can't even get a month's membership "3 months minimum". if you want to get a monthly membership they offer you 12 sessions for 80 quid. scam.

name: Devanshu Mudgal
comment: i have the edge club extra membership for which i pay around £27 per month so i am allowed to go at certain times in the gym. but if you wanna go to steam or sauna after the gym, half of the time you can't because of some practice or event going on. the pressure in the showers is really bad. the gym is so expensive and the fact that you can't access most of the services half of the time makes it worse.

name: Molly Payne
comment: the edge is my university sports centre. the gym it has is very big and has alot of machines and free weights. the pool is nice and there are lots of studios and classes.

name: Tom Xioutas
comment: there are far better places to go and here's why: the edge is malicious and predatory in it's pricing, taking advantage of students. £465 for a year... and that's the cheapest option for me) as a student, i have to pay rent, bills and generally live, money is something i need to keep on top of and univerities understand this. i was in complete shock when i found out an annual subscription cost £465, monthly subscriptions cost £40 or if you want an hour of badmintion it's going to cost £7. if you want to swim that's another subscription too. if you're not a student it's going to cost £540 annually due to the fact i attend leeds beckett i was offered an "alumni" membership. if you're a student at leeds university that's slightly cheaper as it costs £290 annually (which is still predatory on students no matter which university you attend) i recommend looking into leeds beckett memberships in terms of sports. swimming costs £99, sports memeberships cost £139 and the athletic union costs £198/£229.

name: Dimarco Bowes
comment: excellent gym & the receptionist named george is absolutely class, always makes me smile! only thing slightly frustrating is having to wait a while to use equipment sometimes because people are on their phones

name: Ama L
comment: ideal to swim, cold water and sauna/hamam.

name: Nick Cartwright
comment: a decent pool, clean and tidy changing area (although lots of the showers were out of order), and the steam room and sauna were both pleasant.

name: Rory Turnbull
comment: the half of the year the gym is empty its great but it doesn't quite make up for the half the year its super full. swimming pool, sauna and climbing wall are great to have available as a wide selection of classes.

name: Fatih Gezer
comment: the space and the facilities in fitness suite are very limited. they have either one or very few workout machine for a specific workout. so workout tools are always busy and you need to wait for your turn. nobody wipes the tools that they use, so the hygiene is an issue.

name: Dave Fawcett
comment: nice venue very clean and well kept sports centre

name: Eduardo Miguel
comment: i just came to live and study in the uk, found the edge to be the best gym in the area, i purchased a premium membership and chosen my personal trainer -ali kteich- to teach me boxing and help to gain extra muscles, after just few sessions i started the gains and added new skills, i’ll recommend the gym to all my family&friends in the future and give you too many stars eduardo

name: Clarena Amatha
comment: excellent gym with high quality equipment and lo! super friendly staff. having an exquisite time here. so far so good.

name: Katie Sanders
comment: impressive gym featuring a diverse range of excellent classes. the staff is consistently friendly, creating a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere.

name: N.
comment: swimming pool very cold water. my son couldn't stop shaking, later was off school for catching cold. my wife went to women session on fridays and mentioned the cold water to staff on many occasions. the last reply from a member of staff was it's good for health …

name: Zekey Boy
comment: in 2015, i injured my ankle in a life changing injury. i was not supported in the gym and was told to walk down the road to lgi by myself when i was in no position to. years later, i raised this with leeds university and they mentioned that a mistake had been made recording the machine that i had injured myself on -- meaning that after the incident the machine had not been inspected! even worse the health and safety manager who dealt with the concern told me that they were "comfortable" that all health and safety procedures had been followed after my injury, but also acknowledged this mistake that had been made! they were also, in my opinion, extremely rude over the phone conversation -- such to the extent that i had to raise it with their director. thus, i would avoid any centre that leaves people with severe injuries to walk to themselves unaided, that in the past has not inspected possibly risky machines and also has, in my opinion, a very dubious health and safety team. awful, awful, awful.

name: Elliott S
comment: something really needs to be done about the constant staring of the life guards, i fully understand they have a job to do but the constant glaring they do is incredibly off-putting. about 95% of people that use this pool are more than capable of swimming without sinking straight away but the way all of the life guards glare, clearly someone has not told them this. all i want to do is use the pool but i feel constantly judged and watched that it makes the whole experience a really unpleasant one and i just want to leave as soon as i’ve got into the pool. the only clear reason people stay around and try to deal with the bizzare behaviour of the life guards is because there is no other pool nearby. the edge leeds, i implore you to do something about this. it is putting off genuine customers and it is not on when people just want to excercise without being made to feel so uncomfortable. i speak of this by experience as my partner will no longer come with me as the issue i have described made them feel so truly uncomfortable.

name: Ania Horsfall
comment: my child goes there for multi sport holiday camp. he loves it. they do football, swimming, tennis etc. those are only few my child mentioned he really enjoyed. staff very professional, always nice.

name: Dr. Muataz
comment: hi all, i’ve been training for 8 months in the edge gym but recently i’ve cancelled my membership and left to another one. the edge has limited spaces and equipment and the number of people there is always high, so, you have to wait some time for ur turn. the price is so high and you have to pay (joining fee) and beware when you want to cancel your contract, you have to tell them before 2 months. otherwise, they will charge you even if you don’t come to the gym and this happened with me. now, i’m training at another gym in leeds. there is no joining fee and the membership price is only £14 without any contract. the spaces and equipment are just wow. if i knew this gym before, i would not go to the edge.

name: Kate Gers
comment: came to the edge for a roller skating workshop during northern roll festival! it was a great sports hall & very helpful staff on the front desk …

name: Jason H
comment: best gym i've been to. nice and spacious, more cardio machines than you could ever need. huge variety of equipment and great staff.

name: B
comment: great equipment but way too busy, busiest gym i've ever been to they need to expand.

name: Aaron Burningham
comment: has a fair amount of equipment and facilities. the swimming pool is excellent. however, what i found very disappointing,was that on numerous occasions, the reception staff were extremely rude and this needs to be taken very seriously.

name: Ella
comment: great gym with lots of facilities, staff i've talked to have always been very helpful!

name: Kerri Matthews
comment: tried to cancel a membership in june because of very high prices compared to other gyms in city... just had it confirmed i will still be charged in september and then will have september and august refunded... not very impressed.

name: Helen
comment: great facilities but mainly use the pool. which is impossible to book online due to a terrible system. and often overrun in morning partially due to this and partially due to uni teams taking more lanes than they book

name: Jessica Wilkinson
comment: they say they have public wifi available but that's a lie!!!

name: Felicity Lammas
comment: i’ve begun a course of pt classes with trainer ali kteich who’s strengths lie in boxing, whole body strength building and flexibility through dynamic stretching. i have thoroughly enjoyed my sessions so far already seeing results after only three sessions. ali will allow you to achieve the results you want, understand your body type and what exercises are necessary to reach your goals and adapt your sessions to suit you ensuring injury free training. he’s highly motivating and runs a highly intensive full body hiit training class every thursday on the gym floor, the class i look forward to attending every week. as an ex boxing professional ali is the best person to develop your combative skills, a sport which works the whole body. he is hoping to develop boxing in the edge to create a potential boxing society come the new year which i would love to be involved in. i’d highly recommend ali to anyone especially if you want fast results and willing to work hard.

name: Waqas Rasul
comment: can be a bit crowded and a few maintenance problems when i go. unwiped floors, sometimes the showers don't work properly, but everything is pretty standard and what you'd expect from a gym

name: Naim Azhar
comment: the edge has high-end facility and committed staffs. i enjoy going for badminton session there with my friends. i am looking forward for my next session. see you there!!

name: Leandro Vieira
comment: ultra busy, even at the most expensive membership. they don't have enough amount of equipments in order to attend the contingency. for instance, they have only one crossover machine, two pull-over, etc. super frustrating. on the other hand, they have plenty of cardio machines, which i can't understand, once most part are always idle.

name: Bohdan Bon
comment: i did climbing for the first time and it was an absolutely fabulous experience. instructor helen was very supportive and her passionate attitude towards climbing inspired me much to do it again! thank you!

name: Max Gee
comment: great gym with all new equipment. also the staff is very friendly and is willing to help with any questions you may have.

name: Pierluigi Rubino
comment: amazing swimming pool. all sorts of courts available. the downside is that they do not accept long time booking. so you need to book your court every two weeks.

name: Barbora Talabiška
comment: amazing & friendly staff at the reception. they were very helpful explaining how the facilities work

name: Trent McLean-Ash
comment: one of the best gyms i've been to. something for everyone and great links to the uni. staff are pleasant and coaches are well educated and experienced.

name: Kate Louisa Bancroft
comment: great badminton courts. lovely and clean facilities. only downfall is it is quite hard to get through on the phone to make or change a booking.

name: Malik Bennabi
comment: the facility is good and clean. the life guards who work at the swimming pool keep laughing at people who are not swimmers. all they do is keep looking at them, laughing and taking to each other about them on their wireless talkie walkies. very disrespectful and annoying.

name: carrie-ann wilsher
comment: i had a brilliant time at the edge the instructor at aqua mobility is great and doesn't push you as i'm disabled and in pain all the time moving in water makes it easier to move,..

name: Kristina Azenaite
comment: the best pool water i have ever experienced. soft, no cl, perfect t for long swimming. water as blue as in photos, no dirt floating

name: Jonny Billington
comment: great facilities, really friendly helpful staff and easy to book and use. also s decent price for the badminton court!

name: Clara Nascimento-Pillitz
comment: if you are looking for a personal trainer at the edge gym, to help guide you on your fitness journey, i would highly recommend ali kteich. ali is extremely competent in his field, with extensive knowledge in muscle building and toning, core training, flexibility, boxing and more. today in my first session with him, he assessed me and noticed that i have accumulated tension in my neck and shoulders which is causing pain in my upper and lower back. ali showed me a few effective stretches to do to ease the tension and strengthen the muscles that are currently weak and underworked. he also did pnf stretches to help joint mobility and increase flexibility, as well as some core training. on top of being an excellent personal trainer, ali is very kind, enthusiastic and encouraging. he truly cares about his clients and their wellbeing and because of this, he has gained a lot of respect and credibility for what he does. 5 stars!! need a personal trainer? book a session with ali kteich, i promise you will not regret it!

name: Andrew Bannister
comment: brilliant facility and equipment. they even do full sports performance, fitness and heart rate assessments and public pool provision and timings are good. very impressed

name: Jonathan Woodhouse
comment: good sports facilities and free parking up to 3 hours. often very warm inside. expensive guest fees.

name: David Barker
comment: university owned gym with good equipment. can get very busy in university term time. gym, pool, sports halls, squash courts and climbing wall

name: Simon Slater
comment: uni of leeds sports centre, great facilities, well looked after, clean, highly recommended

name: Leandro Russo
comment: the gym is amazing, and the staff is incredibly welcoming. special praise to tian, peter, and dale for welcoming me.

name: Michael Speakman
comment: great pool with a lovely sauna and steam room. only issue is that the pool is too often closed for events, especially at the weekends, meaning that it's often a bit to crowded when it's open

name: Daniel Zango
comment: some of the guys at the front desk don't know which lessons are being given or changes in the schedule and, which is worse, they won't even bother to try to get the information for you. i've never felt so ignored at a reception.

name: Maia Matofska-Dyer
comment: lovely staff, ali was super helpful with all of my membership questions, great atmosphere and huge range of classes !

name: eoin leen
comment: good college gym. lot's of weights, resistance machines and cardio machines. however gets very, very busy during term time.

name: Will Smyths
comment: a member of staff was/is very rude. make two complaints three months apart, once at the counter, another time via email, no response whatsoever. he's still there. i avoid him even if only he is free. i rather wait for someone else.

name: Ben O'Brien
comment: very good pool, though i'd try a few times before committing to a membership - they have an annoying habit of scheduling lessons and team practice during peak times so it's often hard to swim outside work hours.

name: Sonjida Mesket Simi
comment: as a student of university of leeds, i am blessed that i have gym in my campus. 15 minute walk from st. marks residences

name: Saleh Almutawa
comment: gym is great and equipped good gear and has amazing facilities

name: Clare Ingle
